contentrichtext.text: {{For|the [[genus]] of [[noctuidae|noctuid]] [[moth]]s|Chalciope (moth)}} '''Chalciope''' ({{Lang-el|Χαλκιόπη}}), in [[Greek mythology]], is a name that may refer to several characters. * '''Chalciope''', daughter of King [[Aeetes]] of [[Colchis]], sister of [[Medea]] and wife of [[Phrixus]], by whom she had four sons: Argus, [[Phrontis]], [[Melas (mythology)|Melas]] and Cytisorus (some authors add [[Presbon]]).<ref>Pseudo-[[Apollodorus of Athens|Apollodorus]], ''[[Bibliotheca (Pseudo-Apollodorus)|Bibliotheca]]'' 1. 9. 1</ref><ref name="Hyginus, Fabulae, 3">[[Hyginus]], ''Fabulae'', 3 (he erroneously refers to Cytisorus as "Cylindrus")</ref><ref>[[Pausanias (geographer)|Pausanias]], ''Description of Greece'', 9. 34. 8</ref><ref>[[Scholia]] on [[Apollonius Rhodius]], ''Argonautica'', 2. 1122</ref> When Aeetes was dethroned and banished by his brother [[Perses (brother of Aeetes)|Perses]], Chalciope expressed great filial devotion and stayed by her father's side,<ref>[[Hyginus]], ''Fabulae'', 254</ref> even though he had killed her husband.<ref name="Hyginus, Fabulae, 3" /> [[Hesiod]] referred to her as '''Iophossa''',<ref>Cited in [[scholia]] on [[Apollonius Rhodius]], ''Argonautica'', 2. 1122</ref> and [[Pherecydes of Leros|Pherecydes]] as '''Euenia'''.<ref>[[Scholia]] on [[Apollonius Rhodius]], ''Argonautica'', 2. 1149</ref> *'''Chalciope''', daughter of [[Rhexenor (disambiguation)|Rhexenor]] (or of [[Chalcodon]]) and the second wife of [[Aegeas]]. She bore him no heirs.<ref>''[[Bibliotheca (Pseudo-Apollodorus)|Bibliotheca]]'' 3. 15. 6</ref><ref>[[Athenaeus]], ''Banquet of the Learned'', 13. 4</ref> *'''Chalciope''', daughter of [[Eurypylus]] of [[Kos|Cos]], mother of [[Thessalus]] by [[Heracles]].<ref>Pseudo-[[Apollodorus of Athens|Apollodorus]], ''[[Bibliotheca (Pseudo-Apollodorus)|Bibliotheca]]'' 2. 7. 8</ref><ref>[[Plutarch]], ''[[Quaestiones Graecae]]'', 58</ref> *'''Chalciope''', consort of the aforementioned Thessalus, mother of his son [[Antiphus]],<ref>[[Hyginus]], ''Fabulae'', 97</ref> presumably also of [[Pheidippus]] and Nesson.<ref>[[Homer]], ''Iliad'', 2. 679</ref><ref>[[Strabo]], ''Geography'', 9. 5. 23</ref> *'''Chalciope''' or '''Chalcippe''', daughter of [[Phalerus]].<ref>[[Scholia]] on [[Apollonius Rhodius]], ''Argonautica'', 1. 97</ref> ==References== {{reflist}} {{Greek myth index}} [[Category:Women in Greek mythology]] [[Category:Colchis in mythology]] {{Greek-myth-stub}}
